answers.answer: You're perfectly fine, was it measuring from an ultrasound or fundal height using the tape measure? My fundal height always measured 2-3 weeks behind, and although i did have a small baby (5lb 13oz) he was perfectly healthy. And that was at 39 weeks. AND i had gestational diabetes, go figure. So i wouldn't worry about it too much, only being 1 week out is fine.Also, i'll just add that my sister always measured 2 weeks ahead, and her bub was a little on the larger side, (8lb 14oz) but he was healthy too, just a bigger boy, didn't help that his dad was a big man too!!
It was from a tape measure!  All three of my other babies were 7lb ers..maybe this one will be bigger?

question: I'm 29wks today and doctor said i'm measuring at 30wks. ..? Could I be 30wks?  She said u could measure a wk bigger or smaller and its ok..so far I've gained exactly 20lbs. .I don't think that's an excessive amount! My doctor said becouse of the diabetes they don't want me to gain more than 5lbs more?  I was thinking I'll prob gain 11 to 15 more based on my other three pregnancies? Ldk
title: measuring a week bigger
